kotlin.question: You can access enum values in generic way.
kotlin.explanation: Since Kotlin 1.1, it's possible to access the constants in an enum class in a generic way, using the enumValues<T>() and enumValueOf<T>() functions.

kotlin.question: What is the default trimMargin() margin prefix?
kotlin.explanation: The default is |, but you can provide your own margin delimiter as parameter, e. g. trimMargin("#")

Names of test methods can have spaces.
kotlin.explanation: True, because test names can be written in backticks which includes spaces.

kotlin.question: Which ones creates array of nulls?
kotlin.explanation: Would be correct, because in kotlin you have to explicitly name type as nullable.

kotlin.explanation: Concatenation of string with other types is valid when first element is a string e. g.

kotlin.question: How to make a class inheritable?
kotlin.explanation: Since Kotlin 1.1 sealed classes can be inherited.

kotlin.question: What does the method with open keyword do in final class?
kotlin.explanation: The open modifier has no effect when added on members of a final class (i.e.. a class with no open modifier).

kotlin.question: Override keyword is open itself.
kotlin.explanation: Use final override for method to be final.

kotlin.question: You can override var property with val property.
kotlin.explanation: You can override a val property with a var property, but not vice versa.

kotlin.question_code_snippet:
interface Shape { val vertexCount: Int } 
 class Rectangle(override val vertexCount: Int = 4) : Shape
kotlin.question: Is valid.
How to call super class functions and properties in derived class?
kotlin.explanation: Code in a derived class can call its superclass functions and property accessors implementations using the super keyword.

kotlin.question: You can override a non-abstract open member with an abstract one.
You can omit the property type if it has a getter method.
kotlin.explanation: Since Kotlin 1.1, you can omit the property type if it can be inferred from the getter e. g.

kotlin.question: In code interface A { fun foo() } function foo is abstract.
kotlin.explanation: It is default for functions without body in interfaces to be abstract.

kotlin.question: What is the signature of functional interfaces?
correct_answers: fun interface IntPredicate { fun accept(i: Int): Boolean }
incorrect_answers: interface fun IntPredicate { fun accept(i: Int): Boolean }
functional IntPredicate { fun accept(i: Int): Boolean }

kotlin.question: Functional interfaces can have more than one member.
kotlin.explanation: Functional interfaces can have multiple non-abstract members and one abstract member.

kotlin.question: Outer class can see private members of its inner classes.
What visibility the overridden protected members have if not specified?
kotlin.explanation: The overriding member will also have a protected visibility.

kotlin.question: What happens when the extension function signature is the same as class member?
You can have extension functions for companion objects.
You can destruct data class?
kotlin.explanation: Yes, because data classes implement componentN() functions.
